result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyleen S. Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 MONTH PAYMENT PLAN TO COMMENCE 7/1/15. AGREED TO $15 PAYMENT PLAN FEE

Sentenced to 10 days in Marquette County jail with huber to include childcare. Report on or before August 4, 2015 clean & sober. 
May transfer to Wood County if arrangements are made.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: TRANSCRIPT OF PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING ON 6/4/15 - KAREN BLAIR, REPORTER

Initial Appearance on 3/30/15
Reporter:  Karen Blair

Preliminary Hearing on 4/23/15
Reporter:  Karen Blair

Defendant Kyleen S. Roth in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. MOVE TO AMEND COUNT 1 TO MISDEMEANOR POSSESSION-TAKE AWAY REPEATER. DEFENDANT ENTER NO CONTEST PLEA TO AMENDED CHARGE. D.A.: SENTENCE TO 10 DAYS CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE. 5 DAYS CREDIT FOR TIME SERVED.    TRANSFER TO        COUNTY. 60 DAY STAY TO START. $243.00 COSTS. COURT PRESENTED WAIVER OF RIGHT TO ATTY. DEFENDANT UNDERSTANDS.   Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. COURT: Sentenced to 10 days jail with huber. Credit for 5 days. Allow 60 days stay to report clean & sober. Allow childcare. Transfer to Wood County if arrangements are made. $243.00 costs. payment plan $50 per month  July 1, 2015. Def agrees to $15.payment plan

Defendant Kyleen S. Roth in court.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant wants to waive her right to an Attorney and meet with the DA.  Court questions the defendant regarding the Prelim.  
Defendant would like to waive the Prelim today.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of the Prelim.

  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Atty Bonnett files the information with the court.    Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Arraignment scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant would like to hire her own attorney.  Defendant waives the time limits for preliminary hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Set for preliminary hearing.
*Not to possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kyleen S. Roth by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
